findings.description: Configuration files containing credentials, database info, and API keys are accessible.
findings.evidence:
[33K] web.config containing database credentials
[18K] settings.ini with API keys
findings.remediation: Move config files outside web root. Use environment variables for sensitive data. Implement .htaccess restrictions.

findings.description: Configuration files containing credentials, database info, and API keys are accessible.
findings.evidence:
[33K] web.config containing database credentials
[18K] settings.ini with API keys
findings.remediation: Move config files outside web root. Use environment variables for sensitive data. Implement .htaccess restrictions.

findings.description: Admin panels accessible without proper authentication or with default credentials.
findings.evidence:
Admin login panel at /admin/login.php
Default credentials: admin/admin detected as valid
findings.remediation: Require strong authentication. IP whitelist admin interfaces. Disable default accounts.

findings.description: Backup files (.bak, .backup, .old) are accessible via web, exposing sensitive code and configurations.
findings.remediation: Remove backup files from web root. Use .gitignore and deployment scripts to prevent accidental inclusion.

findings.description: Backup files (.bak, .backup, .old) are accessible via web, exposing sensitive code and configurations.
findings.remediation: Remove backup files from web root. Use .gitignore and deployment scripts to prevent accidental inclusion.

findings.description: Web server directory indexing is enabled, allowing attackers to browse file structure.
findings.remediation: Disable directory listing in web server configuration (Options -Indexes in Apache, remove default.aspx in IIS).

findings.description: Debug information, stack traces, and error messages reveal application internals and versions.
findings.evidence:
Fatal error in /app/upload.php on line 45
Stack trace: [...]
MySQL Error: Table 'users' not found
findings.remediation: Disable debug mode in production. Implement custom error pages. Configure proper logging.

findings.description: Application version numbers in banners, headers, or error messages allow targeted exploitation.
findings.evidence:
Server: Apache/2.4.41 (Ubuntu)
X-Powered-By: PHP/7.4.3
Content-Management-System: WordPress 5.8.1
findings.remediation: Remove version strings from HTTP headers. Customize server banners.
